result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form requesting a bail reduction filed by the defendant. **Bail has since been posted, this can be addressed at next hearing if necessary**
Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's exhibit #1 - Driver's abstract
From Prelim Hearing

9:47 AM Defendant Mitch C Erwin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Mitch C Erwin.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Mitch C Erwin.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Griffis requests to withdraw from the case as attorney Schoenfeldt was retained.
The Court grants the motion to withdraw and withdraws attorney Griffis from the case.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Brandon Pipp, of the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Brejcha.
Cross examination by attorney Schoenfeldt.
ADA Brejcha moves to admit State's exhibit #1.  No objection from attorney Schoenfeldt.  The Court receives State's exhibit #1. 
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/7/22 filed by the defendant requesting a bail reduction or modification.
Atty Mark Schoenfeldt

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Justin Griffis
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 10/4/22.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with victim A (EXCEPTION: unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

3:13 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Mitch C Erwin in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Mitch C Erwin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
